questions.prompt: Adjust the parameters until oscillation near the minimum occurs. Explain why this happens visually.
Two models behave differently under the same data. Identify the visual cue that explains the difference.
Induce a failure related to learning rate without changing the dataset.
Reverse engineer the parameters from the final visual state.
Predict how the visualization changes if learning rate is increased.
Compare two outcomes and rank them by stability.
Build a configuration that minimizes error while avoiding instability.
Explain why a visually better result performs worse.
Find the smallest change that breaks the model.
Stabilize the system after intentional sabotage.
